item.title: On the public pavement on the corner of Belsize Grove and Haverstock Hill, 21st August
item.description:
A large area of paving slabs (approx 9) are very uneven and potentially very dangerous to pedestrians. Several edges that are sticking up making it easy to trip over them, especially as the weather will soon get wetter in the autumn and darker as evenings draw in. Some of the slabs wobble when you step on them. Several partially sighted people live in the nearby area and I am very concerned this paving is of particularly of danger to them and could cause a really nasty accident. (I came back from holiday on 1st August 25 and noticed the paving was like this). I do not know why these paving slabs are a different colour from the others or have been placed so badly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 174, Haverstock Hill, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
